intro: Rhynchosia caaguazuensis, commonly known as the Caaguazú burr legume, is a species native to South America, particularly found in Paraguay and Brazil. It is a climbing legume characterized by its trifoliate leaves and distinctive yellow flowers. The plant produces elongated, woody pods that contain several seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical regions, often in disturbed or open habitats. Rhynchosia caaguazuensis is notable for its role in soil enrichment due to its nitrogen-fixing ability.
